description.raw:
It turned out to be quite tricky to get a QLabel to elide its text in a way that was
compatible with it being rich text. Now we could just give up on having labels with
bold text in them, but that have been the easy way out.

This pull request adds a widget that, rather than being a QLabel with
elided text, wraps an existing QLabel, putting it in a QScrollArea so as
to only show part of the QLabel. An additional label displaying ellipsis "..."
is shown next to the QScrollArea to indicate that some of the text is not
being shown. This only really works well for single lines of text. The tooltip shows the full text.

The module also has a function for modifying an existing QLabel that already lives in a layout.
That way this can be applied to QLabels that from .ui files. This is done by reparenting the QLabel to the QScrollArea, and then inserting the result back into the layout at the position where the label was.

Minor version bump since new functionality introduced, so programs using this feature can
rely on check_version() to ensure they have the feautre. (version number with 'prerelease' suffix,
to be removed when tagged as a new version in mercurial. check_version works fine with this)

Here's a test: ![elide_label.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/KEMMje/images/3498332852-elide_label.png)
